page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Most of the{soil}in Broughton is on {chalk}so the soil is thin and dries out easily in the summer. Because it would be difficult to care for animals so far from the farm where there is not any water, most of the land is used for growing{cereal crops}like {barley}and{wheat.}But there are two {dairy herds}on the lower land and some {sheep}to the east of the region. There is a small amount of soil that grows peas and beans. Several of the small farms have been taken over by larger farms, there are now thirteen farms left in the area. There is one set of allotments in Broughton where people grow vegetables and flowers. Farming was once the main employment in Broughton, but now few people work on the land, and large machines do the work.
